feed.title: LF-Air
feed.subtitle: RSS feed based on RSS and LLM.

entry.title: Vite report on Thu, 14 Sep 2023 20:02:18
entry.summary:
Tech:
- All eyes are on ARM as the chipmaker prepares for its IPO, testing confidence in the AI boom.
- Electric Hydrogen receives its first firm order for its unique 100MW electrolyser.
- OpenAI plans to open its first EU office as it prepares for regulatory hurdles.
- The role of generative AI in the next phase of middleware.

Business:
- ProShare Advisors LLC sells 61054 shares of John Wiley & Sons.
- US commercial-property crisis deepens with office vacancy rate hitting a new record.
- Calif. passes strongest right-to-repair bill yet, requiring 7 years of parts.
- Binance's CEO sees signing up another 100 million crypto users as a big challenge.

AI:
- All eyes are on ARM as the chipmaker prepares for its IPO, testing confidence in the AI boom.
- The role of generative AI in the next phase of middleware.

Other:
- Personal loan interest rates remain steady at 4.60%.
- I stopped saving much for retirement and found 3 more important things to spend money on.
- Earth's mysterious core may be encased by an ancient ocean floor with mountains 5 times taller than Everest.
- Apple's new iPhone 15 disappoints fans.
- Video shows Lauren Boebert giving the middle finger after being kicked out of a performance.
- Elon Musk and his siblings put tiny firecrackers in a boyfriend's cigarettes, book says.
- Elon Musk had to take random drug tests after smoking weed on a podcast.
- Elon Musk refuses to answer if he is responsible for dead Ukrainians.
- What it's like to be a ski patroller in an expensive mountain town.
- What the Luddites can teach us about the next tech rebellion.
- Israel's startup funding drops as its cyber sector takes a hit.
- Arm shares set to start trading in biggest IPO in almost 2 years.
- Elon Musk rebuked by Taiwan after appearing to defend the one-China policy.
- Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway sells $158 million of HP stock in 3 days.
- The stock market bull run is in its twilight, says Fidelity's global macro head.
- Mortgage interest rates inch up, but they should fall as inflation slows.
- An American in Sweden is shocked to see a baby alone in a stroller.

Insights:
- The IPO of ARM is a significant event for the AI industry and will test investor confidence.
- Generative AI is playing a crucial role in the development of middleware.
- The commercial-property crisis in the US is deepening, with office vacancy rates reaching new highs.
- Elon Musk's actions and statements continue to generate controversy and speculation.
- The right-to-repair movement gains momentum with California passing a strong bill.
- The tech rebellion and the impact of automation on jobs are topics of interest.
- The global macro head at Fidelity believes the stock market bull run is nearing its end.
- Interest rates for personal loans and mortgages are fluctuating.
- Cultural differences and observations can be surprising when moving to a new country.
